ElementKeypress_event.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The keypress event is fired when a key that produces a character value is pressed down.

remarks.para: Examples of keys that produce a character value are alphabetic, numeric, and punctuation keys. Examples of keys that don't produce a character value are modifier keys such as <kbd>Alt</kbd>, <kbd>Shift</kbd>, <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>, or <kbd>Meta</kbd>.

blockquote.para: Warning: Since this event has been deprecated, you should use beforeinput or keydown instead.

remarks.para:
-The interface, which the event also targets.
-Related events:-input
-keydown
-keyup
